page.title: 14SOCIAL LIFE CHANGES 1925-65
page.content: In 1925 employment was mainly in coalmining and shipbuilding. People provided their own entertainment. Usually journey's to Southwick or Washington were walked. Many were jobless. The area around Hylton Castle was farmland, only being developed after the 2nd World War. Colliery houses had two bedrooms, a living room, washouse and boiler in the back yard. Washing was hung in the back lane. Work was hard, wages low, hours long. There was only a Lloyd George pension scheme, pensioners receiving ten shillings per week. Health was poor and life expectancy not going much beyond 65 years. Dr Holiday was the only G.P.and the National Health Service did not exist. The three R's were taught and at 14 you left school.
